item.title: K add a quote by Laurence Gonzales
item.description: "We don't understand the power of nature and the world because we don't live with it. Our environment is designed to sustain us. We are the domestic pets of a human zoo called civilization." -- Laurence Gonzales

item.title: K add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "what matters most is how well you walk through the fire" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: K add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself." -- Henry Miller

item.title: K add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: K add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "When the going gets weird, the weird turn professional." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: K add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "THE EDGE, there is no honest way to explain it because the only people who really know where it is are the ones who have gone over." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: K add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "It never got weird enough for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: K add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Life has become immeasurably better since I have been forced to stop taking it seriously." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: K add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: K add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "In a closed society where everybody's guilty, the only crime is getting caught. In a world of thieves, the only final sin is stupidity." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: K add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind. Buy the ticket, take the ride...and if it occasionally gets a little heavier than what you had in mind, well...maybe chalk it off to forced conscious expansion: Tune in, freak out, get beaten." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: K add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Sex without love is as hollow and ridiculous as love without sex." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: K add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Without this playing with fantasy, no creative work has ever yet come to birth. The debt we owe to the play of the imagination is incalculable." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: K add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: K add a quote by Walter Elliot
item.description: "Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other." -- Walter Elliot

item.title: K add a quote by Émile Zola
item.description: "The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work." -- Émile Zola

item.title: K add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The intellect has little to do on the road to discovery. There comes a leap in consciousness, call it Intuition or what you will, the solution comes to you and you don't know how or why." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: K add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "To compel a man to furnish funds for the propagation of ideas he disbelieves and abhors is sinful and tyrannical." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: K add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: K add a quote by Epictetus
item.description: "If anyone tells you that a certain person speaks ill of you, do not make excuses about what is said of you but answer, "He was ignorant of my other faults, else he would not have mentioned these alone." -- Epictetus

item.title: K add a quote by Michel Houellebecq
item.description: "Et l'amour, où tout est facile, Où tout est donné dans l'instant; Il existe au milieu du temps La possibilité d'une île." -- Michel Houellebecq

item.title: K add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it." -- George Orwell

item.title: K add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Character is higher than intellect. A great soul will be strong to live as well as think." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: K add a quote by Thucydides
item.description: "It is useless to attack a man who could not be controlled even if conquered, while failure would leave us in an even worse position." -- Thucydides

item.title: K add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "But the truth was that he died from solitude, the enemy known but to a few on this Earth, and whom only the simplest of us are fit to withstand. The brilliant Costaguanaro of the boulevards had died from solititude and want of faith in himself and others." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: K add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "He that is the author of war lets loose the whole contagion of hell and opens a vein that bleeds a nation to death." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: K add a quote by William Shakespeare
K add a quote by Alvin Toffler
item.description: "The illiterate of the 21st century will not be those who cannot read and write, but those who cannot learn, unlearn, and relearn. " -- Alvin Toffler

item.title: K add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K add a quote by Cicero Marcus Tullius
item.description: "Men decide far more problems by hate, love, lust, rage, sorrow, joy, hope, fear, illusion or some other inward emotion, than by reality, authority, any legal standard, judicial precedent, or statute." -- Cicero Marcus Tullius
